metadata.title: CVE-2019-20386 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - low
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in button_open in login/logind-button.c in systemdbefore 243. When executing the udevadm trigger command, a memory leak mayoccur.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-20386` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss-myhostname - 244-3ubuntu1
libnss-mymachines - 244-3ubuntu1
libnss-resolve - 244-3ubuntu1
libnss-systemd - 244-3ubuntu1
libpam-systemd - 244-3ubuntu1
libsystemd-shared - 244-3ubuntu1
libsystemd0 - 244-3ubuntu1
libudev1 - 244-3ubuntu1
systemd - 244-3ubuntu1
systemd-boot - 244-3ubuntu1
systemd-boot-efi - 244-3ubuntu1
systemd-container - 244-3ubuntu1
systemd-coredump - 244-3ubuntu1
systemd-homed - 244-3ubuntu1
systemd-journal-remote - 244-3ubuntu1
systemd-oomd - 244-3ubuntu1
systemd-resolved - 244-3ubuntu1
systemd-standalone-sysusers - 244-3ubuntu1
systemd-standalone-tmpfiles - 244-3ubuntu1
systemd-sysv - 244-3ubuntu1
systemd-tests - 244-3ubuntu1
systemd-timesyncd - 244-3ubuntu1
systemd-userdbd - 244-3ubuntu1
udev - 244-3ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: systemd package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '244-3ubuntu1').
